properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 8 at 9:35PM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY IN THE CASCADES FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...

.After a brief lull in precipitation Thursday, a series of strong
disturbances will impact the Pacific Northwest beginning Friday
morning, bringing heavy snow to the Cascades. At this time the
heaviest snow looks to fall Friday afternoon through Saturday
morning before gradually decreasing Saturday afternoon.
Additional rounds of heavy snow are possible later this weekend
into early next week.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. New snow
accumulations of 1 to 4 inches tonight. For the Winter Storm
Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up 2
feet possible Friday through Saturday. Winds could gust as high
as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Cascades in Lane County.

* WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Near
blizzard conditions expected later Friday through Saturday. This
will not be a time for unnecessary travel over the Cascades.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT HAS BEEN CANCELLED
